name: Laufey
title: Laufey - Norse Mythology
subtitle:
Mother of
     
      Loki
shortDescription: Mother of Loki , also known as Nal. Little is known about her beyond her role as Loki 's mother. Her name means "leafy island" or "tree," suggesting a connection to nature.
longDescription: Laufey appears briefly in the sources as the mother of Loki by the giant Farbauti. Some traditions suggest she may have been a goddess or giantess associated with trees or islands. Her son Loki inherited his shapeshifting abilities and cunning nature, though whether these came from his mother or father remains unclear in the myths.

sections.title: Mythology
sections.content: Laufey appears briefly in the sources as the mother of Loki by the giant Farbauti. Some traditions suggest she may have been a goddess or giantess associated with trees or islands. Her son Loki inherited his shapeshifting abilities and cunning nature, though whether these came from his mother or father remains unclear in the myths.

relatedConcepts.name: üçÉ DIVINE MOTHER
relatedConcepts.description: Laufey represents the Divine Mother archetype in its mysterious aspect - the origin of a great power, whose nature hints at nature and transformation.
